intro: Pityopsis aspera var. adenolepis, commonly known as the roughleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in summer. It is often found in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
